intro: Euphrasia viscosa proles brigantiaca, commonly known as the sticky eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are glandular and often covered in a sticky substance, which gives it its common name. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
